text: Job’s Seventh Speech: A Response to Zophar
Then\f + \fr 21:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered and said,
“Listen carefully to my words,
and let this be your\f + \fr 21:2 \ft Plural \f* consolation.
Bear \add with\add* me, and I myself\f + \fr 21:3 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will speak;
then\f + \fr 21:3 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* after my speaking you can mock.
\add As for\add* me, \add is\add* my complaint for human beings?
And if \add so\add*, why cannot I be impatient?
Turn to me and be appalled,
and place \add your\add* hand on \add your\add* mouth.
And when I think of \add it\add*, I am horrified,\f + \fr 21:6 \ft Hebrew “and I am horrified” \f*
and shuddering seizes my flesh.
“Why do \add the\add* wicked live,
grow old, even grow mighty \add in\add* power?
With them their offspring \add are\add* established ⸤before them⸥,\f + \fr 21:8 \ft Literally “to their faces” \f*
and their descendants before their eyes.
Their houses \add are\add* safe without fear,
and the rod of God \add is\add* not upon them.
His bull breeds and does not fail;
his cow calves and does not miscarry.
They send out their little ones like the flock,
and their children dance around.
They ⸤sing⸥\f + \fr 21:12 \ft Literally “they lift up \fq their voices \ft ” \f* to \add the\add* tambourine and lyre,
and they rejoice to \add the\add* sound of \add the\add* long flute.
They spend their days in prosperity,
and in peace they go down to Sheol.
And they say to God, ‘Turn away from us,
for\f + \fr 21:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* we do not desire to know your ways.
Who \add is\add* Shaddai that we should serve him,
or\f + \fr 21:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* what would we benefit when we plead with him?’
Look, their prosperity \add is\add* not in their hands;
the schemes of \add the\add* wicked are repugnant\f + \fr 21:16 \ft Or “the plan of \fq the \ft wicked is repugnant” \f* to me.
“How often is \add the\add* lamp of \add the\add* wicked put out,
and their disaster comes upon them?
He\f + \fr 21:17 \ft The antecedent is “God,” or possibly “the Almighty” \f* distributes pains in his anger.
\add How often\add* are they like straw ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 21:18 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* the wind,
and like chaff that \add the\add* storm carries away?
‘God stores up his iniquity for his children’?\f + \fr 21:19 \ft Or “\fq You say, \ft ‘God stores up his iniquity for his children.’ ” \f*
\add Then\add* let him repay \add it\add* to him that\f + \fr 21:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he may know.
Let his eyes see his decay,
and let him drink from the wrath of Shaddai,
for what ⸤does he care for⸥\f + \fr 21:21 \ft Literally “his joy in” \f* his house after him,
when the number of his months is\f + \fr 21:21 \ft Hebrew “are” \f* cut off?
Can anyone teach knowledge to God,
since\f + \fr 21:22 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he himself\f + \fr 21:22 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* judges high ones?
This \add one\add* dies ⸤in full prosperity⸥,\f + \fr 21:23 \ft Literally “in the vigor of his prosperity” \f*
⸤completely⸥\f + \fr 21:23 \ft Literally “all of him” \f* at ease and secure.
His vats are full \add with\add* milk
and the marrow of his bones is moist.
Yet\f + \fr 21:25 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* another dies with a bitter inner self\f + \fr 21:25 \ft Or “soul” \f*
and has not tasted prosperity.
They lie down together in \add the\add* dust,
and maggots cover them.
“Look, I know your\f + \fr 21:27 \ft Plural \f* thoughts
and \add the\add* schemes you devise against me.
For you say, ‘Where is the nobleman’s house,
and where \add are\add* ⸤the tents in which the wicked dwell⸥?’\f + \fr 21:28 \ft Literally “tent of dwelling places of wicked” \f*
Do you not ask \add those\add* traveling \add the\add* roads,
and do you not take notice of their accounts?
Indeed, \add the\add* wicked is spared from \add the\add* day of disaster;
he is delivered from \add the\add* day of wrath.
Who denounces his way to his face?
And who repays him \add for what\add* he has done?
When\f + \fr 21:32 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he is brought to \add the\add* grave,
then\f + \fr 21:32 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* someone stands guard over \add the\add* tomb.
\add The\add* clods of \add the\add* valley are sweet to him;
everyone will follow after him,
and ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 21:33 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* him ⸤they are innumerable⸥.\f + \fr 21:33 \ft Literally “there is not number” \f*
So\f + \fr 21:34 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* how will you comfort me \add with\add* emptiness,
when\f + \fr 21:34 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* fraud is left \add in\add* your answers?”
